pageContext.claim: “In Kentucky, we elected everybody. The Governor got brought up in a few short days, 19 points. I went. We made a speech. The whole ticket was there. Everybody won big. Governor's a really good guy, but 19 points is a big thing and he lost by just a few thousand votes. And the headlines the next day: Trump took a loss. I lift him up a lot.”
pageContext.analysis: The narrow loss of Republican governor Matt Bevin in his re-election bid was embarrassing to Trump as he held an election-eve rally in support of Bevin. Trump has seized on a poll by a little-known company, Targoz Market Research, in mid October that found Bevin down by 19 points as evidence Trump had a positive impact in the race. But many other polls said the race was a dead heat, such as a Mason-Dixon poll released on Oct. 26 which showed Bevin even with his Democratic rival, Andy Beshear, at 46 percent. A poll by Trafalgar Group released Nov. 6 said that Bevin was 6 points ahead of Beshear.
